Hereโs what happened in the Latin music world this week. Boza Joins Latin Grammy In The Schools to Support Panamanian High School The Latin Grammy Cultural Foundation partnered with Sony Music and Panamanian artist Boza for Latin Grammy In The Schools, donating instruments to Panama’s Instituto Rubiano and hosting performances, followed by a Q&A with the artist. Instituto Rubiano, one of Panamaโs leading public schools, serves 4,000 students — which offers diplomas in science, humanities, and computer science — aims to “becoming a national model in scientific, humanistic and technological excellence,” mentions a press release. โItโs an honor for me to be part of the Latin Grammy In The Schools program because music was the tool that helped me believe in myself and change the course of my life,โ said Boza in the statement. โSharing that experience with students and showing them that their talent, voice and culture have value is something very special. I hope thiโฆ

title: Inside MusiCaresโ Person of the Year Gala Honoring Mariah Carey, Featuring Foo Fighters, Busta Rhymes, Laufey &ยMore
summary: Jennifer Hudson, Kesha and John Legend were also among those paying homage to Carey at the annual fundraiser.
body: With 19 No. 1 smashes on the Billboard Hot 100 spanning four decades and nine more that reached the top 10, there was no way that performers could even scratch the surface of Mariah Carey โs voluminous catalog of hits Friday night (Jan. 30) when she was honored as MusiCaresโ Person of the Year in Los Angeles, but they gave it a try. To be sure, tackling songs by one of the greatest pop vocalists of all time is not for the faint of heart and add on the nerves of performing in front of said vocalist and credit is due for any of the artists who even felt up to the task. In general, the performers fell into three buckets: Belters, devotees and innovators. Jennifer Hudson , who opened the show with a medley of Carey’s hits, including โVision of Loveโ and โMake It Happen,โ obviously fell in the belter category, as one of the few vocalists with the mighty prowess to power through Careyโs hits. It was an audacious beginning that surely did nothing to quell any butterflies subsequent performers may have had. Also falling squarely in the belter class were Kesha with a spiky version of the swaggering โObsessed,โ Adam Lambert , who delivered an expressive, heartwrenching take on โCanโt โฆ

title: Sombr Covers Olivia Deanโs Hottest 100 Winner โMan I Needโ for triple jโs Like aยVersion
summary: Sombr praised Dean as โa really inspiring and incredible artist,โ adding that the song immediately stood out to him.
body: Sombr has put his own spin on Olivia Deanโs Hottest 100-winning song โMan I Need,โ delivering a fuzzy, indie-leaning cover for triple jโs long-running Like a Version series. The 20-year-old artist tackled the track in-studio alongside his band, just one week after landing inside the top 10 of Australiaโs annual Hottest 100 countdown himself. Introducing the cover, sombr praised Dean as โa really inspiring and incredible artist,โ adding that the song immediately stood out to him. โIt feels so timeless and I love the production, I love the lyrics,โ he said. โEverything about it. Amazing.โ Originally released by Dean in 2024, โMan I Needโ was crowned No. 1 in triple jโs Hottest 100 of 2025, marking one of the yearโs most talked-about wins. Sombrโs rendition strips the track back emotionally while reshaping it sonically, layering distorted vocals and a driving indie-rock pulse over the songโs core melody. The Like a Version appearance marks sombrโs debut on the platform and arrives during a breakout period for the New Yorkโbased artist. Known for blending alt-pop and indie rock with diaristic, emotionally raw songwriting, sombr has quickly built momentum over the past year with a run โฆ

title: Paris Hilton Says a Britney Spears Collaboration Would Be a โDream ComeยTrueโ
summary: "I was just with her recently talking about music again," Hilton said.
body: Paris Hilton has teased the possibility of new music with longtime friend Britney Spears, saying the pair have been talking about a potential collaboration while reconnecting over music and shared experiences. Speaking to Attitude , the media personality and businesswoman said discussions are still in the early stages but confirmed that the idea has been floated more than once. โWe were talking about doing some fun music. And I was just with her recently talking about music again,โ Hilton said. โSo, weโll see what happens. Weโll see.โ Hilton, who is currently working on her third studio album, said collaborating with Spears would be a major full-circle moment. โThat would literally be the most iconic thing ever,โ she added. โThat would be a dream come true.โ The comments come two decades after Hilton released her self-titled debut album Paris in 2006. She returned to pop music in 2024 with her sophomore record Infinite Icon , which marked a renewed creative chapter for the socialite-turned-singer. Elsewhere in the interview, Hilton singled out Blackout as her favourite Spears album, praising the project for its unapologetic tone. โIt was just her being her,โ Hilton said. โAnd she โฆ

title: โWhat a Giftโ: Hollywood Remembers CatherineยOโHara
summary: Dan Levy, Macaulay Culkin and Martin Scorsese were among the stars to pay tribute to the actress following her death at age 71.
body: Hollywood is mourning the death of Catherine OโHara, the beloved actress and comedian whose illustrious career spanned decades across television and film. News of her passing at the age of 71 was confirmed on Friday by her manager, prompting an outpouring of tributes from filmmakers, actors, and collaborators across the entertainment industry. OโHara first rose to prominence as a cast member on SCTV before becoming a defining presence in films including Beetlejuice , Home Alone , Home Alone 2: Lost in New York and a series of Christopher Guest mockumentaries such as Best in Show and For Your Consideration . In the latter part of her career, she became a cultural icon for a new generation with her Emmy-winning performance as Moira Rose on Schittโs Creek . Director Martin Scorsese, who worked with OโHara on his 1985 film After Hours , paid tribute in a statement following the news of her death. โMany people know her from Schittโs Creek . For many others, itโs the Home Alone pictures or Beetlejuice or the Christopher Guest comedies,โ Scorsese said. โFor me, and for most of my friends, itโs SCTV . All I have to do is think about one of the characters she created, like Lola Heatherton โฆ

body: Ricardo Arjona  kicked off his Lo Que El Seco No Dijo U.S. tour on Friday (Jan. 30) with a sold-out show at the Allstate Arena in Chicago, marking the beginning of a 35+ date trek that will bring his music to the most iconic arenas in the country. The Guatemalan singer-songwriter delighted fans by covering his four-decade career with a setlist that included classics like โHistoria de Taxi,โ โEl Problema,โ and โMujeres,โ as well as songs from his latest album, Seco , released in January 2025. Related All the U.S. Tours from Latin Artists Announced for 2026 (Updating) This tour represents the evolution of the concept born last year during his historic residency in Guatemala, featuring a theatrical setup and constant interaction with the audience, now expanded for major North American arenas, according to a press release. Produced by Metamorfosis, Zamora Live, and Fรฉnix Entertainment, Lo Que El Seco No Dijo marks Arjonaโs return to the stage after his Blanco y Negro: Volver Tour of 2023, which grossed $27.3 million with the sale of 224,341 tickets, according to figures reported to Billboard Boxscore, placing it at No. 11 among the Top Latin Tours of that year. title: NASA Selects Axiom Space for Fifth Private Mission to Space Station
summary: NASA and Axiom Space have signed an order for the fifth private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, targeted to launch no earlier than January 2027 from the agencyโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida. โThe award of our fifth private astronaut mission shows that commercial space is nโฆ
body: Credit: NASA NASA and Axiom Space have signed an order for the fifth private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, targeted to launch no earlier than January 2027 from the agencyโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida. โThe award of our fifth private astronaut mission shows that commercial space is not a distant promise, but a present reality,โ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. โBy expanding access and sharpening competition in low Earth orbit, these missions are building the capabilities NASA will rely on as we move outward to the Moon, Mars, and beyond. We look forward to building upon those capabilities with many private astronaut missions to come.โ Axiom Mission 5 is expected to spend up to 14 days aboard the space station. A specific launch date will depend on overall spacecraft traffic at the orbital outpost and other planning considerations. โThe International Space Station is a critical platform for enabling commercial industry in low Earth orbit,โ said Dana Weigel, manager, International Space Station Program, NASAโs Johnson Space Center in Houston. โPrivate astronaut missions allow the station to be used as a proving ground for new markets and technologiโฆ

title: NASA Aims to Advance Hypersonic Flight Testing with New Awards
summary: While NASA is working with U.S. aviation to explore commercial supersonic technologies, the agency is also looking forward to an even faster era of flight โ one of vehicles that can fly hypersonic, or five times the speed of sound. And to further that vision, NASA has issued two awards for studies โฆ
body: 3 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) The NASA award to SpaceWorks Enterprises will focus on research using the companyโs X-60 platform. SpaceWorks While NASA is working with U.S. aviation to explore commercial supersonic technologies, the agency is also looking forward to an even faster era of flight โ one of vehicles that can fly hypersonic, or five times the speed of sound. And to further that vision, NASA has issued two awards for studies into vehicle concepts.  Some types of vehicles โ such as rockets โ achieve hypersonic speeds by carrying supplies of oxygen to allow their fuel to burn, instead of using the surrounding air. In contrast, NASAโs Hypersonic Technology Project works to advance โairbreathing,โ reusable hypersonic aircraft, which take in air as they fly, allowing for much longer sustained cruising at hypersonic speeds.  Given commercial interest in finding applications for airbreathing hypersonic vehicles, the Hypersonic Technology Project is looking to find ways to make testing and development easier. Two contract awards the project made โฆ

body: 2 Min Read Visualizing Perseveranceโs AI-Planned Drive on Mars PIA26646 Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech Photojournal Navigation Science Photojournal Visualizing Perseveranceโsโฆ Photojournal Home Photojournal Search Latest Content Galleries Feedback RSS About Downloads Visualizing Perseveranceโs AI-Planned Drive on Mars PNG (326.26 KB) PIA26646 Animation MP4 (157.38 MB) Description This animation of NASAโs Perseverance was created with the Caspian visualization tool using data acquired during an 807-foot (246-meter) drive on the rim of Jezero Crater made by the rover on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. The missionโs โdrivers,โ or rover planners, use the information to understand the Perseveranceโs autonomous decision-making process during its drive by showing why it chose one specific path over other options. This was one of two drives, the first being on Dec. 8, in which generative artificial intelligence provided the route planning. The AI analyzed high-resolution orbital imagery from the HiRISE (High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment) camera aboard NASAโs Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter and terrain-slope data from digital elevation models to identify criโฆ

body: NASA Cold Atom Lab team members were presented with the following NASA Honor Awards. From left to right, Kamal Oudrhiri, Sarah Rees, Jason Williams, and Ethan Elliott. NASA/JPL-Caltech NASA OUTSTANDING PUBLIC LEADERSHIP MEDAL Awarded for notable leadership accomplishments that have significantly influenced NASAโs mission. Sustained leadership and exceptionally high-impact leadership achievements demonstrate the individualโs effectiveness in advancing NASAโs goals and image in present and future terms. Kamal Oudrhiri โ For outstanding leadership of the Cold Atom Laboratory, NASAโs first quantum laboratory in space. NASA EXCEPTIONAL SCIENTIFIC ACHIEVEMENT MEDAL Awarded for exceptional scientific contributions toward achievement of NASAโs mission. This award is given for individual efforts that have resulted in a key scientific discovery or resulted in contribution(s) of fundamental importance in this field or significantly enhanced understanding of the field. Jason Williams โ For exceptional scientific achievements enabling and performing the first pathfinding experiments in quantum sensing of inertial forces with atom interferometry in space. NASA EXCEPTIONAL PUBLIC ACHIEVEMENT MEDโฆ

title: Video: Perseverance Roverโs View of Crater Rim Drive
summary: Description This animation shows Perseveranceโs point of view during drive of 807 feet (246 meters) along the rim of Jezero Crater on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. Captured over two hours and 35 minutes, 53 Navigation Camera (Navcam) image pairs were combined with โฆ
body: 1 Min Read Video: Perseverance Roverโs View of Crater Rim Drive PIA26647 Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech Photojournal Navigation Science Photojournal Video: Perseverance Roverโsโฆ Photojournal Home Photojournal Search Latest Content Galleries Feedback RSS About Downloads Video: Perseverance Roverโs View of Crater Rim Drive JPEG (659.02 KB) PIA26647 Animation MP4 (125.55 MB) Description This animation shows Perseveranceโs point of view during drive of 807 feet (246 meters) along the rim of Jezero Crater on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. Captured over two hours and 35 minutes, 53 Navigation Camera (Navcam) image pairs were combined with rover data on orientation, wheel speed, and steering angle, as well as data from Perseveranceโs Inertial Measurement Unit, and placed into a 3D virtual environment. The result is this reconstruction with virtual frames inserted about every 4 inches (0.1 meters) of drive progress. NASAโs Jet Propulsion Laboratory, which is managed for the agency by Caltech, built and manages operations of the Perseverance rover. For more about Perseverance: science.nasa.gov/mission/mars-2020-perseverance/ Keep Exploring Discover More Topics Fโฆ

title: Mapping Perseveranceโs Route With AI
summary: Description This annotated image from NASAโs HiRISE (High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment) camera aboard the agencyโs Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter image depicts the AI-planned route and the actual route taken by NASAโs Perseverance Mars rover during its 807-foot (246-meter) drive on Dec. 10, 2โฆ
body: 2 Min Read Mapping Perseveranceโs Route With AI PIA26645 Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/UofA Photojournal Navigation Science Photojournal Mapping Perseveranceโs Routeโฆ Photojournal Home Photojournal Search Latest Content Galleries Feedback RSS About Downloads Mapping Perseveranceโs Route With AI PNG (1,003.24 KB) Description This annotated image from NASAโs HiRISE (High Resolution Imaging Science Experiment) camera aboard the agencyโs Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter image depicts the AI-planned route and the actual route taken by NASAโs Perseverance Mars rover during its 807-foot (246-meter) drive on Dec. 10, 2025, the 1,709th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. The drive was the second of two demonstrations โ the first being on Dec. 8 โ showing that generative artificial intelligence could be incorporated in the roverโs route planning. The magenta lines depict the path the roverโs wheels would take if it were to follow AI-processed waypoints, which are indicated with the magenta circles. (Waypoints are fixed locations where the rover takes up a new set of instructions.) The orange lines are based on data downlinked after the drive was complete and depict the actual path the rover took. Tโฆ

title: NASAโs Perseverance Rover Completes First AI-PlannedยDriveยon Mars
summary: The team for the six-wheeled scientist used a vision-capable AI to create a safe route over the Red Planetโs surface without the input of human route planners. NASAโs Perseverance Mars rover has completed the first drives on another world that were planned by artificial intelligence. Executed on Deโฆ
body: NASAโs Perseverance used its navigation cameras to capture its drive along the rim of Jezero Crater on Dec. 10, 2025. The navcam images were combined with rover data and placed into a 3D virtual environment, resulting in this reconstruction with virtual frames inserted about every 4 inches (0.1 meters) of drive progress. NASA/JPL-Caltech The team for the six-wheeled scientist used a vision-capable AI to create a safe route over the Red Planetโs surface without the input of human route planners.   NASAโs Perseverance Mars rover has completed the first drives on another world that were planned by artificial intelligence. Executed on Dec. 8 and 10, and led by the agencyโs Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Southern California, the demonstration used generative AI to create waypoints for Perseverance, a complex decision-making task typically performed manually by the missionโs human rover planners.   โThis demonstration shows how far our capabilities have advanced and broadens how we will explore other worlds,โ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. โAโฆ

title: Whatโs Up: February 2026 Skywatching Tips from NASA
summary: NASAโs Artemis II mission has its first opportunity to launch to the moon, Orion the Hunter takes center stage, and a planetary parade marches across the night sky.
body: The Moon readies for Artemis II, Orion shines bright, and a planetary parade marches across the night sky NASAโs Artemis II mission has its first opportunity to launch to the moon, Orion the Hunter takes center stage, and a planetary parade marches across the night sky. Skywatching Highlights Feb: Artemis II launch window opens. Feb: Orion the Hunter ideal viewing Mid-Late Feb: Planetary Parade Transcript The Moon could have human visitors for the first time since 1972, the constellation Orion will be clear to see, and a planetary parade will sparkle across the skies. Thatโs Whatโs Up, this February. The Moon could have some visitors soon! NASAโs Artemis II mission will send astronauts to fly around the Moon. The first opportunities for launch are this February. This mission will pave the way for Artemis III, which will be the first time weโve sent humans to the lunar surface since the final Apollo mission, Apollo 17, in 1972. So this month, look up to the Moon shining bright in the night sky and there might be somebody looking back down at you. Can you spot Orion the Hunter in the night sky? NASA/JPL-Caltech You might be able to see the line of three stars that make up Orionโs Beโฆ

title: Preparing for Artemis II: Training for a Mission Around the Moon
summary: Four astronauts will soon travel beyond low Earth orbit and fly around the Moon on Artemis II, a mission that will test NASAโs systems and hardware for human exploration of deep space. Since June 2023, NASA astronauts Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Koch, and CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astrโฆ
body: 4 Min Read Preparing for Artemis II: Training for a Mission Around the Moon Artemis II astronauts, from left, NASA astronaut Victor Glover, CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astronaut Jeremy Hansen, and NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Reid Wiseman stand on the crew access arm of the mobile launcher as part of an integrated ground systems test at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Credits: NASA/Frank Michaux Four astronauts will soon travel beyond low Earth orbit and fly around the Moon on Artemis II , a mission that will test NASA’s systems and hardware for human exploration of deep space.  Since June 2023, NASA astronauts Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Koch, and CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astronaut Jeremy Hansen have been preparing for their lunar journey. The approximately 10-day mission will test the SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft, named  Integrity  by the crew, while requiring the quartet to operate with greater autonomy and make critical decisions far from Earth. Training for Artemis II is all risk mitigation. By preparing the astronauts and flight conโฆ

title: Goldstoneโs DSS-15 Antenna and the Milky Way
summary: Deep Space Station 15, one of the 112-foot antennas at the Goldstone Deep Space Communications Complex near Barstow, California, looks skyward, with the stars of the Milky Way overhead, in September 2025. Goldstone is part of NASAโs Deep Space Network (DSN), which operates three complexes around thโฆ
body: NASA/JPL-Caltech Deep Space Station 15, one of the 112-foot antennas at the Goldstone Deep Space Communications Complex near Barstow, California, looks skyward, with the stars of the Milky Way overhead, in September 2025. Goldstone is part of NASAโs Deep Space Network (DSN), which operates three complexes around the globe that support communications with dozens of deep space missions. The DSN is NASAโs international array of giant radio antennas that supports interplanetary spacecraft missions, plus a few that orbit Earth. The DSN also provides radar and radio astronomy observations that improve our understanding of the solar system and the larger universe. Through Artemis, NASA is establishing an enduring presence in space and exploring more of the Moon than ever before. To achieve this, Artemis missions rely on both the Deep Space Network and the Near Space Network . These networks, with oversight by NASAโs SCaN ( Space Communications and Navigation ) Program office, use global infrastructure and relay satellites to ensure seamless communications and tracking as Orion launches, orbits Earth, travels to the Moon, and returns home. Image credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech

summary: To address the growing global health challenge of obesity, which affects more than 1 billion people, WHO has released its first guideline on the use of Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) therapies for treating obesity as a chronic, relapsing disease.

title: New prevention tools and investment in services essential in the fight against AIDS
summary: On World AIDS Day, the World Health Organization (WHO) calls on governments and partners to rapidly expand access to new WHO-approved tools including lenacapavir (LEN) to drive down infections and counter disruption to essential health services caused by cuts to foreign aid. title: WHO issues first global guideline on infertility
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today called on countries to make fertility care safer, fairer and more affordable for all in its first-ever global guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility.Infertility is estimated to affect 1 in 6 people of reproductive age at some pโฆ

title: Measles deaths down 88% since 2000, but cases surge
summary: Global immunization efforts have led to an 88% drop in measles deaths between 2000 and 2024, according to a new report from the World Health Organization (WHO). Nearly 59 million lives have been saved by the measles vaccine since 2000.

title: Lifetime toll: 840 million women faced partner or sexual violence
summary: Violence against women remains one of the worldโs most persistent and under-addressed human rights crises, with very little progress in two decades, according to a landmark report released today by the World Health Organization (WHO) and UN partners. Nearly 1 in 3 women โ estimated 840 million globโฆ

title: More countries report rising levels of drug-resistant gonorrhoea, warns WHO
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) warns that gonorrhoea, a sexually transmitted infection, is becoming increasingly resistant to antibiotics, according to new data from its Enhanced Gonococcal Antimicrobial Surveillance Programme (EGASP), which monitors the spread of drug-resistant gonorrhoea. title: World marks cervical cancer elimination day as countries accelerate action
summary: Today marks the first World Cervical Cancer Elimination Day โ mandated by the World Health Assembly โ a historic milestone in global efforts to end a preventable cancer.

title: WHO promotes lifesaving intervention for small and preterm babies on first official World Prematurity Day
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) is marking its first official observance of World Prematurity Day with the launch of a new global clinical practice guide for Kangaroo Mother Care (KMC) โ a simple, proven and life-saving intervention that significantly improves survival for preterm and low birthโฆ

title: WHO and Brazil urge swift action on Belรฉm Health Action Plan at COP30
summary: The COP30 Special report on health and climate change: delivering the Belรฉm Health Action Plan, notes that rising temperatures and collapsing health systems are claiming more lives, and calls for immediate and coordinated action to protect health in a rapidly warming world.
